page.title: 12Barton Gravel Pit
page.content: Barton gravel pit,located to the east of the A38 near Barton,is owned by Amalgamated Road Stone Corporation. Sand and gravel are excavated to use in the building and construction industries. After excavation the gravel is taken to the sorting plant by conveyer belt. The stone is dropped onto a stockpile which is fed into the sorting plant. The gravel is separated into two grades,building and concrete. It is then washed to remove sand and is further sorted into sizes determined by demand. Most of the aggregate is transported to the new M42 Motorway under construction at Tamworth.The quarry also supplies building merchants,farmers,drainage contractors etc. Nine people are employed at the quarry and work is expected to last for another 60 years. Archeological evidence has been found.
